The Clinton campaign, the Priorities USA super PAC and the Democratic National Committee raised a combined $112.3 million and started September with $121.4 million stockpiled.
The Trump campaign raised $41.8 million and spent $29.9 million, ending the month with $50.2 million on hand, according to its report to the Federal Election Commission.

| AP Photo Trump trailed Clinton with $50 million in cash in August

Hillary Clinton and her allies extended their financial lead over Donald Trump in August.
Great America PAC and Make America Number 1, two super PACs supporting Trump, raised $3.6 million and $1.1 million, respectively.
Together with supporting super PACs and the Republican National Committee, he had almost $96 million in the bank.
The Trump campaign raised $41.8 million and spent $29.9 million, ending the month with $50.2 million on hand.
